Journey

I was born and raised in Yangon, a buzzling city in Myanmar. With the unconditional support of
my parents, I was able to attend Crane International School Myanmar on merit and need based
scholarship until Grade 10. Being more enthusiastic to explore more opportunities, I took a
gap year volunteering at local communities organizations helping the elderly and orphages while
taking part in YMCA and YWCA's charitable volunteering activites. After this incredible year
I won a full scholarship to attend an IB international boarding high school located among
the beautiful mountains and fjords of Norway. In this beautiful place, I was roomates with
students from all over the world including an Ethiopian, Palestinian, Canadian and Norwegian in
my first year and in my second year, I shared room with a Malaysian, Portugese, Ghanian and
a Nepali. I had a chance to go skiiing, hiking, kayaking in the fjords, ice skating and experiencing exotic
Norweign traditions. These 2 years will forever be the best years of my life. After this
incredible two years, I had a chance to study Computer Science at the Unversity of Florida, again on
full scholarship where I will graduate in May 2021.
